channel.title: Silab Client -- 'java' is not recognized
channel.description:
[code] C:\Documents and Settings\Compaq_Administrator\Desktop\Silab Client>java -Xmx500 m -jar client.jar 0 0 highmem members 0 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
C:\Documents and Settings\Compaq_Administrator\Desktop\Silab Client>pause Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Can anyone help me fix this problem?

item.title: Silab Client -- 'java' is not recognized
item.dc:creator: @killamess killamess
item.description:
@killamess wrote:

search on google for jdk1.6.0_03, download it then replace your compiler with this@echo off

color 0a
title server Compiler
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe" *.java
pause

YOU DO NOT HAVE TO SET CLASSPATHS, i dont know why everyone thinks its needed

Read full topic

item.title: Silab Client -- 'java' is not recognized
item.dc:creator: @Vengeance Vengeance
item.description:
@Vengeance wrote:

[quote="~M°ose~, post:4, topic:178515"]No, I do have Java.
And Ollie I did what you said and now im getting this error

'JAVA' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

What version of Java do you have?
Try these if you dont have number 4
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin
and mine isnt PATH its CLASSPATH, try those

Read full topic

item.title: Silab Client -- 'java' is not recognized
item.dc:creator: @viruz_3 viruz 3
item.description:
@viruz_3 wrote:

You probably dont have Java. Get it http://www.java.com/

Read full topic

item.title: Silab Client -- 'java' is not recognized
item.dc:creator: @Olli3 Olli3
item.description:
@Olli3 wrote:

Lol , go to My Computer , View System Information.
Advanced
Variable Environment
Click ‘New’ on the top one , type in CLASSPATH and and in the bottom bar type in :
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_04\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
Then click ‘ok’ , then click NEW on the other one
Then type in PATH
Then type in the other box : C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_04\bin
And click ‘ok’ and try once more. BTW i was expecting you have JDKu4.
Enjoy!

Read full topic

operable program or batch file.

Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
